name: Hotel Meyrick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent one night in the Meyrick and it was all positive. The hotel was very welcoming and comfortable. Would definitley stay here again. The city centre location was ideal, along with both the valet parking which suited my husband, and as I arrived seperatly by train, the proximity to the train station was a bonus.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The Meryick Hotel is in a great location, right in the middle of Galway City - oionce your car is whisked away by the efficient Valet, we didn't need it again until the end of our stay. There is a lovely atmosphere the minute your walk into the foyer with a lovely fire and comfortable seating where you could just sit and watch the world go by while listening to the wonderful live pianist. The room was lovley while a little old fashioned but clean and spotless. We found the staff most helpful. However, there is one aspect of this hotel which completely lets it down and that is the gym - it is supposed to be "state of the art" but this is far from reality - the machines are really old and one of the treadmills was broken for the whole time we were there. There is no ventiliation at all apart from two delapated fans, one of which came apart in my hand, but the worst thing is that the gym is dirty. There is nothing to clean the machines down after you use them - there was a spray in the corner of the room but no paper towels to be used with them - I asked for some and was given a few but when I went back the following day, there were no paper towels again or the other days I was there. There are cobwebs and dust everywhere and the place looks like it has not received a good cleaning in years - the shower area is the same - the area is old and grotty but nothing that a bit of elbow grease won't shift - such a pity as the views from the gym area extend all over the city and with just a little effort this area could easily be brought right up to scratch.
reviews.title: Great Location - gym very disappointing

reviews.text: Since the last time I stayed here a few years ago the Meyrick has seriously upped its game! If you are heading to Galway stay here! Great value, we were upgraded to an amazing suite, inexpensive valet parking, fantastic food, can't say enough good things about our stay!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Meyrick was very accomodating--we called just over a day before our anticipated arrival and the front desk personnel were ready, willing to accomodate our unusual size party. I was traveling with family--total--3 adults--we needed a "triple". They were able to accommodate this request with a perfect 3 single beds!!!! Very rare for a last minute accomodation in most any hotel. It's location is also perfect for walking around and about downtown Galway--enjoy, enjoy, enjoy! Close enough to the Quay (prncd-"Key") area. It's a cross between Dublin's Grafton and Temple Bar--Hate to say it--but. . . . . if a place could be friendlier than Dublin (rare) there is Galway's Quay area, that would take the prize! Thank you Hotel Meyrick for an awesome last minute accomodation!-- Yours Truly, OC California
reviews.title: Last Minute Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed in the Meyrick for a midweek break in February and had a great stay. I'd highly recommend this hotel for many reasons - its excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff and its stylish and comfortable rooms. The location is unbeatable and the valet parking makes for a very relaxed city break. We were able to walk everywhere, you cant get closer to the shops and nightlife. We both used the spa and enjoyed lovely massages as well as the outdoor hot tub which is super. Breakfast was very good with lots of variety and the staff throughout the hotel were very attentive. For what we paid the value was excellent. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable with a large bathroom. We enjoyed our break immensely and are already looking forward to our return to the Meyrick!
reviews.title: Excellent location, staff & rooms. We'll be back!

reviews.text: Booked the Meyrick almost a year ago for a weekend for my Mother and all her friends for a weekend for her Birthday, the staff could not have been more accommodating no matter how many times I had to ring to amend the booking. We arrived and the staff were so friendly and welcoming giving a tour of all the main hall and bar area and where to go for breakfast. The hotel itself is gorgeous and very stylish and the whole weekend was made so easy because of how friendly and helpful the entire staff were. Loved it there and would recommend to anyone staying in Galway.
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL EVER

reviews.text: My husband and I spent a night in one of the Meyrick Hotel's suites overlooking Eyre square; what a lovely room. The staff at the reception, restaurant and spa were so very genuinely helpful and friendly. The food was good; the location excellent. The only fault, and it was a minor one was that the hot tub at the spa was not as hot as it should be, especially considering the cold January outdoor temperature during our stay. Overall a great hotel - we'll be back!
reviews.title: Excellent location, service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good deal on this hotel and stayed in a fab room, possibly termed a suite! It was Room 316. A lovely surprise when we saw the four poster bed. The furniture was antique and the bathroom, lined in marble, with jacuzzi bath and rain shower, was huge. You could read about all the famous guests who had stayed in the hotel and imagine them right there in the room, as the furniture and decor may not have changed in all that time! As well as that, the room overlooked Eyre Square, which gave the impression of looking down on the whoel world beneath! Another opportunity to look down on the world is afforded from the hot tub perched on a limb outside the spa - but actually the view is not pretty. The hot tub was too hot!!
reviews.title: Lovely Old World ambience

reviews.text: The hot stone massage in the spa ticked all the boxes! The therapist, Claire, was really good.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Breakfast, and Fantastic Staff

reviews.text: Our deal included dinner. The service was very good, but the table d'hote menu is not exciting. We ate well though. The best part was the dessert; a nougat ice cream!!
reviews.title: 5 Star Bliss

reviews.text: Hotel - beautiful large and welcoming lobby with an open fire. Perfect for enjoying a coffee and meeting your group in the morning. Lots of marble. Very nice hotel bar with a sports bar in the basement.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: the doubles in our group had huge palatial rooms! Beautiful. I had a single which was very nice indeed with a hot and powerful shower. Very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Returning to my little taste of paridise at The Meyrick.

reviews.text: Staff: could not be better. This was a family trip to celebrate my parents 50th wedding anniversary and they had their wedding reception at this hotel. The staff could not have been more accommodating to make the weekend special. Thank you.
reviews.title: Sad old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: dinner was faultless. Breakfast was hearty with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Excellent stay. Great Manager

reviews.text: Location: could not be better. Directly on Eyre Square in the heart of the city and the train and bus station is 30 seconds walk!
reviews.title: The best in Galway

reviews.text: I stayed here as one of a group of 25 . I stayed in a single room , decor was nice , room was cleanish but really stank of cigarettes . As a non smoker , I asked to be moved , despite the first solution of " spraying Febreeze " they did eventually move me. The hotel is in a great location , the food was very good but unfortunately the staff let this hotel down badly , at different times and for various reasons up to half our group had issues with staff, the bar staff were very rude , as was the night porter - commenting on people wanting a Late night drink , there was no residence bar available . This is a pity as this hotel has a lot to offer .
reviews.title: Disappointing !

reviews.text: Valet car park, room upgrade....excellent. Location for shopping and sight seeing is excellent.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Old fashioned room but very comfortable, with spacious bathroom. Hotel lobby has a lovely ambience about it. Didn't eat in restaurant but ate in Fagans which wasn't good at all.
reviews.title: Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most staff seemed friendly but impersonal and a massive let down when I sat over 35 mins waiting on my car to leave!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay, amazing value, great staff

reviews.text: I'm writing this review during my stay. My husband and I received a 2 nights stay in the executive suite with breakfast, dinner for 2 at the Oyster Grill and spa treatments as a wedding gift. We've found the hotel to be in an excellent location and the view of Eyre Square from the top level exceptional. All of the shops and high rated pubs are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Good Location.

description: Perfectly located in the heart of Galway City, the 4 star Hotel Meyrick combines stunning Victorian elegance with modern luxury and style. Enjoy luxurious accommodation, a range of bar and dining options from the fine dining Oyster Grill Restaurant and the elegant Oyster Bar to the relaxed and inviting Fagan’s Bar as well as soothing spa treatments in the Square Spa. Ideally situated overlooking bustling Eyre Square, the delights of Galway are on your doorstep.
